title: ISic001355. Funerary inscription for Eutychios
body:
1 [π]ίστεως χά-
2 [ρι]ν Ἀβραμί-
3 [οι]ς ἐ <ν> κόλποις
4 [λ] α̣χὼν Εὐτύχι-
5 [ος] ἐνθὰδε κῖτε
6 [ζήσ]ας ἔτη λε ´ τε-
7 [λευτᾷ] τῇ (πρὸ) ϛ ´ εἰδ ῶ (ν)
8 [. c. 5.]βρίων
9 christogram

l.3 ν

1[.]ΙΣΤΕΩΣΧΑ
2[..]ΝΑΒΡΑΜΙ
3[..]ΣΕΙΚΟΛΠΟΙΣ
4[.].ΧΩΝΕΥΤΥΧΙ
5[..]ΕΝΘΑΔΕΚΙΤΕ
6[...]ΑΣΕΤΗΛΕΤΕ
7[.....]ΤΗϚΕΙΔΩ
8[·····]ΒΡΙΩΝ
9christogram

l.3 ν

Facsimile Images

Apparatus criticus

English translation

Jonathan Prag

Here lies Eutychios who, on account of his faith, has received his place in the lap of Abraham. Having lived 35 years, he died on the 6th day before the Ides of [---]ber.

Italian translation

Serena Agod

Qui giace Eutychios che, per la sua fede, ha ricevuto il suo posto nel grembo di Abramo. Dopo aver vissuto 35 anni, morì sei giorni prima delle Idi di [---]ber.

commentary

Eutychios is a fairly common name, but rare in Sicily. The text is Christian, as indicated by the phrase enthade kite and the chi-rho symbol at the end, but the initial phrase is strongly Jewish in form. Some have suggested that Eutychios was Jew who converted to Christianity, but it is simpler to see this as a good example of the extensive interaction and influence between the Christian and Jewish communities in ancient Catania.

  • Ferrua 1989 no.441 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001995
  • 799 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000394
